poem:
**Mediterranean Waters**  

Voices ripple against the hull,  
fettered to the iron tide.  
In Patras and Katakolo, shadows  
tangle with the sun.  

The sea whispers barricades,  
each crest a silent sentinel.  
Protests wash upon the shore,  
while the ship, a floating nation, dreams  
of land unmoored and free—  
or waves that tell no sides.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Greek police increase security after protests against Israeli cruise ship Greek authorities have stepped up security in two harbours in an attempt to keep protesters away from a cruise liner carrying Israeli tourists on an 11-day tour around the Mediterranean. The measures taken at Patras and Katakolo in the Peloponnese followed demonstrations when the MS Crown Iris docked at Kalamata earlier this week. In July passengers on the same ship were prevented from disembarking and". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
